title: Michelle Yeoh captivates fans and critics in her newest role in 'The Brothers Sun'
description: Oscar winner Michelle Yeoh is receiving widespread praise for her performance in Netflix’s “The Brothers Sun.”

title: States have been eliminating taxes on period products for years. Here’s where you'll still pay them.
description: Many states have eliminated sales tax on tampons, pads and other period products, but 21 still impose them. A map shows which states have a so-called tampon tax.

title: Lloyd Austin's prostate procedure: When is surgery considered 'elective'?
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin was diagnosed with prostate cancer and had elective surgery to treat it. What is elective surgery?

title: CES 2024 tech you can buy now
description: Most gadgets from CES are just prototypes. These are ready to purchase right now.

title: FTC settlement bars data broker from selling sensitive location info
description: Outlogic, a Virginia-based data broker, agreed to stop selling sensitive location data that helps track people’s whereabouts, as part of the Federal Trade Commission’s first data tracking settlement.

title: Body found in same Houston home where a rapper allegedly held a woman captive for years
description: Less than two months after a pregnant woman was rescued from a Houston home where she'd allegedly been held against her will for at least four years, another woman was found dead in that same house, officials said Tuesday.

title: 11 best gadgets from CES 2024
description: Each year, hundreds of the biggest names in tech make their way to Las Vegas for the Consumer Electronics Expo, or CES.

title: SEC says it did not yet approve Bitcoin ETF, X account was compromised
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said Tuesday afternoon that an announcement about bitcoin ETFs on social media was incorrect.

title: Twelve arrested after New York synagogue break-in amid secret tunnel dispute
description: Twelve Hasidic Jewish worshippers were arrested Monday after breaking into the Chabad-Lubavitch world headquarters in Crown Heights, New York, and allegedly damaging the synagogue underneath it, according to officials.

title: Department of Education error could lower U.S. students' financial aid amount
description: An error in how the Department of Education calculates financial aid threatens to leave some U.S. students with lower subsidy amounts for their secondary schooling this fall.

title: Second transgender woman’s candidacy for Ohio House is challenged
description: A second transgender woman’s petition to run for the Ohio House of Representatives is being challenged because she did not disclose her birth name.

title: Black man who spent 44 years in prison before he was exonerated gets record $25M settlement
description: A Black North Carolina man who spent 44 years in prison after he was wrongfully convicted of raping a prominent white woman has been awarded a historic $25 million settlement more than three years after he was exonerated.

title: Private mission to the moon won't land on lunar surface after malfunction
description: A privately built spacecraft that launched Monday on a mission to land on the moon will not reach the lunar surface after it suffered a critical malfunction hours after liftoff.

title: Flooding, blizzards, tornadoes to impact millions across U.S.
description: Dangerous winter weather has become deadly as it continues to impact more than half of the country. Blizzard conditions in the Plains, flooding in the Northeast and tornadoes in the South. Bill Karins details the storms path.

title: Even Andrew Scott was startled by his vulnerability in ‘All of Us Strangers’
description: In Andrew Haigh’s new film, “All of Us Strangers,” Andrew Scott plays a lonely gay screenwriter working on a script about his childhood

title: This city is attempting to end homelessness with houses made out of shipping containers
description: Newark, N.J. is rolling out transitional homes made out of shipping containers as part of an effort to end to homelessness in the city, officials announced Monday.

title: Marijuana-filled diaper and Naruto throwing knives among items passengers tried to sneak onto planes in 2023
description: An explosive hidden inside an energy drink can and a knife inside a prosthetic foot were two of the most bizarre items Transportation Security Administration officials discovered last year.

title: Angela Bassett and Mel Brooks to take home honorary Oscars
description: Angela Bassett, Mel Brooks and film editor Carol Littleton will take home honorary Academy Awards tonight. Michelle Satter will win a humanitarian award. This will be Bassett's and Littleton's first Oscar; Brooks won in 1969 for writing "The Producers."

title: Ray Epps, a Jan. 6 defendant 'scapegoated' by far-right media, sentenced to probation
description: Jan. 6 rioter Ray Epps, who faced threats and right-wing conspiracy theories, was sentenced to probation on Tuesday.

title: NRA distances itself from longtime leader Wayne LaPierre in opening remarks at civil trial
description: The National Rifle Association is the “victim of betrayal,” an attorney said Tuesday as she sought to distinguish longtime leader Wayne LaPierre from the gun rights group during opening arguments in the civil trial against it and its executives.

title: Bob Menendez claims 'persecution' in Senate floor remarks after latest allegations
description: Sen. Bob Menendez, D-N.J., denied bribery allegations against him involving Qatar and pushed back on calls from his Senate colleagues to resign in floor remarks.

title: NFL offers buyouts to more than 200 employees
description: The National Football League offered voluntary buyouts to at least 200 employees as it gears up for start of the playoffs this coming weekend, according to a memo obtained by CNBC.

title: Everything you need to know about practicing yoga
description: The best yoga props, according to yoga teachers. Shop yoga mats, blocks, bolster pillows and more from Amazon, Lululemon, Gaiam, Alo, Manduka and Bala.

title: Colts owner Jim Irsay is being treated for severe respiratory illness
description: Indianapolis Colts owner Jim Irsay is being treated for a severe respiratory illness and will be unable to perform with his band later this week, team officials said Tuesday.

title: Oscar Mayer in search of next 'hotdoggers' to drive the Weinermobile — for $35,600 a year
description: Oscar Mayer announced on Monday it's taking applications for the next class of "hotdoggers," a yearlong opportunity to drive across the country in the iconic 27-foot-long Wienermobile as the brand's spokesperson.

title: Mexican woman released after being jailed 12 years without a conviction
description: In Mexico, Verónica Razo Casales was released  from prison after 12 years without being sentenced or convicted after she was arrested on kidnapping charges; she was also sexually abused and tortured by authorities after her arrest.

title: Israel has a long track record of assassinating its enemies. Will it work against Hamas?
description: Israel has vowed to kill any Hamas militant linked to the Oct. 7 attack, echoing a manhunt 50 years ago to avenge the murder of Israeli athletes at the Munich Olympics.

title: Earth just had its hottest year ever recorded — by far
description: Last year was Earth’s hottest in recorded history, the European Union’s climate agency announced Tuesday, confirming what scientists have been expecting — and dreading.

title: Fisherman named the suspect in 3 cold cases, including 2 of Va.'s 'Colonial Parkway Murders'
description: A dead fisherman has been identified as the suspect in three cold-case homicides in Virginia from the 1980s, including two of the notorious "Colonial Parkway Murders" that once stoked fears in the area.

title: Lisa Bonet files for divorce from Jason Momoa, more than three years after they separated
description: Lisa Bonet and Jason Momoa are officially divorcing, almost exactly two years after they publicly announced their separation.

title: Taiwan presidential candidate gave away laundry pods to remind people to vote. 3 people ate them
description: At least three people were hospitalized after mistakenly eating colorful pods of liquid laundry detergent that were distributed as a campaign freebie in Taiwan’s presidential race, according to Taiwanese media reports.

title: A transgender teen wanted to update his school records. Oklahoma created a rule to stop him.
description: Ryan Walters, Oklahoma's top education official, pushed an emergency rule to prevent students from changing the gender on their school files. One family is suing.

title: Both coasts and central U.S. hammered by winter storms, causing power outages and travel chaos
description: Hundreds of thousands of homes across the U.S. were without power Tuesday, as commuters woke to another morning of snow and rain causing havoc across the country.

title: Scientists find about a quarter million invisible nanoplastic particles in a liter of bottled water
description: The average liter of bottled water has nearly a quarter million invisible pieces of ever so tiny nanoplastics, detected and categorized for the first time by a microscope using dual lasers.

title: Appeals court hears arguments over Trump's immunity claim
description: Listen to live audio as lawyers for former President Trump and special counsel Jack Smith appear for oral arguments before the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit. Trump is claiming he has immunity from prosecution in the election interference case because he was serving as president at the time.

title: Jimmy Kimmel blasts Aaron Rodgers during monologue over Jeffrey Epstein comment
description: Jimmy Kimmel has called on NFL quarterback Aaron Rodgers to apologize for saying the comic would appear in court documents associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Trump to attend immunity hearing and investigators home in on Boeing hardware: Morning Rundown
description: Hardware becomes the focus of the investigation into the near-disaster Alaska Airlines flight.

title: One of the key pieces of Vivek Ramaswamy’s Iowa plan: Free beer
description: Vivek Ramaswamy is inspiring young voters to attend campaign events — with an assist from the free beer he's providing.

title: Trump plans to be in court for 2 days the week before Iowa. His campaign is fine with that.
description: Trump's campaign and allies see this detour away from the Hawkeye State days before the caucuses as a boost, not a detriment, to his bid.

title: Democrats to spend $35M targeting voters of color in House races
description: The Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee announced Tuesday they're spending at least $35m this year to mobilize Latino, Black,  Asian American, Pacific Islander and Native Hawaiian voters to help the party win the House majority.

title: Lawyers for ex-gang leader held in Tupac Shakur killing say he should be released from jail
description: Attorneys for a former Los Angeles-area gang leader charged with orchestrating the killing Tupac Shakur in 1996 say prosecutors are wrong — that their client is facing danger, not witnesses.

title: Explosion at historic Texas hotel injures 21 and scatters debris in downtown Fort Worth
description: An explosion at a historic Texas hotel in Fort Worth on Monday blew out windows and injured 21 people, one critically, authorities said.

title: U.S. national arrested in Russia on drugs trafficking charges
description: U.S. national Robert Romanov Woodland has been arrested and detained on drugs charges in Russia, authorities said Tuesday.

title: Blinken to talk 'way forward' in Gaza as he meets with Israeli leaders
description: Blinken to talk 'way forward' in Gaza as he meets with Israeli leaders

title: Blizzard conditions bear down on central U.S., closing schools and highways
description: A “highly impactful” winter storm delivered a punch to the country’s midsection on Monday, with blizzard conditions dumping as much as a foot or more of snow and shutting down schools and highways in several Midwest states.

title: Trump co-defendant alleges 'improper' relationship between Fani Willis and fellow Georgia prosecutor
description: In a filing seeking to dismiss the charges, Michael Roman’s attorney accused Willis and special prosecutor Nathan Wade of having a romantic relationship.

title: Parents of Iowa teen who killed 1 and wounded 7 in shooting say they had 'no inkling' of his plan
description: The parents of the 17-year-old who killed a sixth grader and wounded seven others in a shooting at his high school said they “had no inkling he intended the horrible violence he was about to inflict.”

title: Trump plans to seek Supreme Court review of Jan. 6 civil cases in another push for immunity
description: A federal appeals court last month denied Donald Trump's claim that presidential immunity should protect him from civil suits related to the Capitol riot.

title: Minnesota doctor accused of fatally poisoning wife indicted on murder charges
description: A medical examiner determined Betty Bowman died after being poisoned by a drug that a tipster told police her husband, Connor Bowman, had researched.

title: Lead border negotiator says no immigration deal this week as key sticking points remain
description: Senate and White House negotiators are nearing a border agreement on new immigration policies but significant gaps remain.

title: 5k rounds of ammo found in home of Arizona man accused of threatening to kill FBI agents
description: During Michael Lee Tomasi’s arrest, agents said they uncovered three firearms, including a Smith & Wesson AR-15-style rifle, and body armor in his residence.

title: Biden appeals to Black voters in South Carolina, amid declining support
description: President Biden spoke at Charleston’s Mother Emanuel AME Church, where a white supremacist killed nine worshippers in 2015. Black voters are a key block for the president, but his support among them is slipping. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez spoke with South Carolina voters who say the president isn’t doing enough on issues like student debt relief and police reform.

title: 11 injured in explosion at downtown Fort Worth hotel
description: Eleven people were injured in an apparent explosion at a downtown hotel in Fort Worth, Texas, on Monday afternoon, authorities said.
